titlestmt.titleproper: International Union of Pure and Applied Chemistry Commission on Atomic Weights and Isotopic Abundances records 1920-1993
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012

did.unittitle: International Union of Pure and Applied Chemistry Commission on Atomic Weights and Isotopic Abundances records

bioghist.p: The International Union of Pure and Applied Chemistry (IUPAC) was formed in 1919 by chemists from industry and academia. Over nearly eight decades, the Union has succeeded in fostering worldwide communications in the chemical sciences and in uniting academic, industrial and public sector chemistry in a common language. IUPAC has long been recognized as the world authority on chemical nomenclature, terminology, standardized methods for measurement, atomic weights and many other critically evaluated data. An International Commission on Atomic Weights (under varying names) has been a central feature of IUPAC since its inception.

scopecontent.p: This collection consists of the records of the Commission on Atomic Weights and Isotopic Abundances (CAWIA), donated by several members of the commission and its various subcommittees. Materials include: correspondence (1920-1993); membership lists and bibliographical data; agendas, minutes, and reports of meetings; published and unpublished papers; isotopic abundances tables and reference materials; and atomic weight reports (1820-1992).

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

acqinfo.p: Provenance: Dr. H. Steffan Peiser for IUPAC

otherfindaid.p: An inventory is available in the repository.

relatedmaterial.p: Related material may be found in the following collections: Chemical Heritage Foundation: International Union of Pure and Applied Chemistry (IUPAC) Records (2003.600.001).
